pr_title: Allows scope decorators to synchorize "extra fields" to logging context

timeline.bodyText: using a mutable array here is intentional. It allows a later change to implement immediate flushing #682
timeline.author: codefromthecrypt

replies.bodyText: Not completely sure but I thought the immediate flushing would mean there are extra fields added, so doesn't it need to be expandable like a List?
replies.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: actually the late thing is change in a value not change in the whitelist. so should be fine. this will be separate change anyway
replies.author: codefromthecrypt

replies.bodyText: yeah this is just late updates keys, set in the builder and immutable after. so the value holder needn't be expandable. If we change later to make this expandable, we would need to update this code, as would other code which assumes the list is fixed.
replies.author: codefromthecrypt

timeline.bodyText: Just want to confirm ExtraFieldPropagation is the only type of propagation this would ever make sense for?
timeline.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: it might not be the only possible thing but it is what's often requested leading to the sleuth thing a couple years ago.
replies.author: codefromthecrypt

replies.bodyText: after thinking about this, yeah I believe it is better to be explicit as we have nothing else and it is hard to predict when we could.
replies.author: codefromthecrypt

timeline.message:
Allows scope decorators to synchorize "extra fields" to logging context

This pulls up a major feature currently only available in Sleuth:

https://github.com/spring-cloud/spring-cloud-sleuth/blob/289ec4755e6bcda77830a25c958c19fb1f5af7e2/spring-cloud-sleuth-core/src/main/java/org/springframework/cloud/sleuth/log/Slf4jScopeDecorator.java#L111-L119

Ex.
```java
currentTraceContext = ThreadLocalCurrentTraceContext.newBuilder()
  .addScopeDecorator(MDCScopeDecorator.newBuilder()
    .addExtraField("user-id") // this pushes the extra field into log scope
    .build())
  .build();
```
